title: It's 20 years since Geri Halliwell wore Brits Union Jack dress for Spice Girls performance | Metro News
text:
Search Metro Follow us It’s been 20 years since Geri Halliwell wore that Union Jack dress for the Spice Girls ICONIC Brits performance Rebecca Lewis for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 3:47 pm GIRL POWER (Picture: Redferns) 
Prepare to feel old – it’s been 20 years since the Spice Girls performed at the Brit Awards and the world was introduced to a whole new version of the Union Jack. Jamie xx, Chase & Status and Solange to join Frank Ocean at Lovebox 2017 
Yep, back in 1997 Sporty Spice, Baby Spice, Ginger Spice, Scary Spice and Posh Spice became the poster girls for Cool Britainnia with a barnstorming performance of Wannabe and Who Do You Think You Are, which of course featured Ginger’s now iconic Union Jack dress – an outfit still inspiring fancy dress costumes around the world even now. 
The performance was a classic – in 2010 they won the Brit Award for Best Brits Performance of 30 Years for the moment – and they also capped off the night by picking up two awards – Best British Video (for Say You’ll Be There) and Best British Single (for Wannabe). 
With just the stage to play with – and no big sets or anything to hid behind – the performance proved that with the right song, and a whole load of attitude, a moment like this will last for generations. That dress (Picture: Redferns)
